subject: Climate & Environment
title: Sponge Cities
description: Learn Sponge Cities in one minute.

hook.text: China is redesigning 30 cities to absorb rain instead of fighting it.

buildup.text: Sponge cities replace concrete with permeable surfaces, rain gardens, and urban wetlands.

discovery.text: These features slow runoff, recharge groundwater, and reduce flooding simultaneously.

twist.text: Copenhagen and Berlin are adopting similar strategies after devastating urban floods.

climax.text: A sponge city turns a rainstorm from a threat into a resource stored for dry days.

punchline.text: The smartest way to fight a flood is to drink it slowly.

quiz.question: What is a sponge city designed to do?
options: Absorb rainwater instead of channeling it away
